back_cards.definition_en: to accept something as true without proof
back_cards.example_en: She assumed he was late because of traffic.

back_cards.definition_en: to take on a role or responsibility
back_cards.example_en: He assumed the position of team leader.
I assume we'll meet at the usual cafe.
The company assumed the competitor's assets.

back_cards.definition_en: to adopt a particular attitude or manner
back_cards.example_en: She assumed a confident tone during the presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who creates written content
back_cards.example_en: The writer published a new novel this year.

back_cards.definition_en: someone who composes articles for news
back_cards.example_en: She works as a writer for a local newspaper.

back_cards.definition_en: an author of scripts for films or plays
back_cards.example_en: The writer crafted a thrilling movie script.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who writes creatively as a hobby
back_cards.example_en: He’s a writer who shares poems online.

back_cards.definition_en: a professional who documents technical manuals
back_cards.example_en: The writer updated the software user guide.

back_cards.definition_en: to carry out an action or task
back_cards.example_en: She performed her duties with great care.

back_cards.definition_en: to act or sing in a show
back_cards.example_en: He performed a song at the talent show.
The car performs well on rough roads.

back_cards.definition_en: to present something to an audience
back_cards.example_en: They performed a play at the community center.

back_cards.definition_en: to execute a skill in a competition
back_cards.example_en: The athlete performed a perfect dive.
She used her credit to buy a new phone.
He received credit for the project’s success.
She earned three credits for the course.

back_cards.definition_en: trust in someone’s ability to pay
back_cards.example_en: The store offered credit to loyal customers.
Her name appeared in the movie credits.

back_cards.definition_en: having the color of grass or lime
back_cards.example_en: The green hills bloomed with flowers.
They adopted green practices to save energy.
He’s still green when it comes to coding.

back_cards.definition_en: related to forest or lime hues
back_cards.example_en: She wore a green dress to the party.
The green bananas weren’t ready to eat.

back_cards.definition_en: a legal union between two people
back_cards.example_en: Their marriage was celebrated with a big party.
The merger was a marriage of two companies.
The marriage took place in a garden.
Their marriage lasted over fifty years.
The marriage followed traditional customs.
The operation to fix her knee was successful.

back_cards.definition_en: the act of running a system
back_cards.example_en: The factory’s operation runs smoothly.
The rescue operation saved many lives.
The company expanded its operation overseas.
Addition is a basic mathematical operation.
It was, indeed, a beautiful sunset.
She is indeed the best candidate.
Indeed, I didn’t expect that news!

back_cards.definition_en: to add emphasis to a fact
back_cards.example_en: The task was indeed challenging.
He failed, and indeed, he didn’t try.
She sleeps soundly every night.

back_cards.definition_en: to be in a state of rest
back_cards.example_en: The baby sleeps through the afternoon.
We’ll sleep at the cabin tonight.
The computer sleeps to save power.
He needs to sleep after the long trip.
Water is necessary for survival.
Studying is necessary to pass the exam.
Change is necessary for progress.
It’s necessary to wear a helmet here.
Patience is necessary when learning skills.
She revealed her plans for the weekend.
The curtain revealed a stunning view.
He revealed the truth about the incident.
The company revealed its latest gadget.
The report revealed financial errors.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who acts for another
back_cards.example_en: The agent negotiated the contract.
The agent investigated the case secretly.
She’s an agent for a real estate firm.
The cleaning agent removed the stain.
The agent signed a new musician.

back_cards.definition_en: the ability to enter a place
back_cards.example_en: Only members have access to the club.
She gained access to the database.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to approach or enter
back_cards.example_en: The gate provides access to the park.
Citizens have access to public records.
The app grants access to your files.
They met at a bar downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: a counter for food or drink
back_cards.example_en: The sushi bar was always busy.

back_cards.definition_en: a long piece of metal or wood
back_cards.example_en: The window had a bar for security.
The song has four bars in the intro.
She passed the bar and became a lawyer.
The debate focused on climate change.
The candidates held a televised debate.
He had a debate with himself about moving.
She won first place in the debate.
The debate shaped the new law.
He injured his leg while running.
The first leg of the trip was tiring.
The table’s leg was wobbly.
She led the final leg of the relay.
They advanced to the next leg of the tournament.
The box contains old photos.
The book contains useful tips.
She tried to contain her excitement.

back_cards.definition_en: to limit the spread of something
back_cards.example_en: Firefighters worked to contain the blaze.
This drink contains natural ingredients.
He beat the drum with enthusiasm.

back_cards.definition_en: to defeat someone in a contest
back_cards.example_en: She beat her opponent in chess.
Beat the eggs for the cake batter.
Her heart beat faster during the speech.
They beat the odds to finish the project.
The cool breeze felt nice.
His new jacket is really cool.
She stayed cool during the crisis.
Store the milk in a cool place.
That band is considered cool by teens.

back_cards.definition_en: related to a system of equal voting
back_cards.example_en: The country held democratic elections.
She has a democratic approach to leadership.
The team made a democratic choice.
The law promotes democratic values.
The program is democratic in its outreach.
